learning_outcomes.description: Appraise the main structural components of eukaryotic cells, including the nucleus and cellular organelles, and evaluate their individual contribution to cellular function.

Identify, understand and relate the molecular components of the cell nucleus and organelles to their function with a special focus on cell division and cell differentiation in a variety of cell types.
Appreciate and connect molecular interactions within and between eukaryotic cells and to the non-cellular environment.
Explain how proteins are processed and transported within the cell after synthesis in order to perform their function.
Investigate experimental approaches that are used in molecular cell biology and identify the most appropriate ones to apply these to develop a strategy to address a current problem in the field.
To comprehend the molecular mechanisms of disease and how this understanding contributes to the development of new tools for diagnosis and treatment.

assessments.task_description:
Short answer questions on the content covered in the lectures. The number of questions and point value of questions from each staff member will reflect the number of lectures given by that staff member. Additional information will be provided on Blackboard and in class.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Practical Assessment - Methods in Molecular Cell Biology Quiz
assessments.due_date:
Practical 1 due: 26/09/2025 5:00 pm

Practical 2 due: 24/10/2025 5:00 pm

The quiz will open at 5pm the day before the listed due date. Students will have 24 hours to complete and submit each quiz.
assessments.task_description:
A combination of multiple choice questions on the learning objectives covered in each practical will be given in the second week of each practical exercise.

Each online quiz will be worth 7.5% of the total assessment for BIOL3006.

Note: Completion of the practical assessment is COMPULSORY.

See Additional Information for instructions on what you need to do if you miss a practical session.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submitted online - within 24 hours of the final practical session.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
7/10/2025 - 15/10/2025

Held in the lecture slots 7 October (Week 10) - 15 October (Week 11).
assessments.task_description:
Students will work collaboratively to produce a PowerPoint presentation to pitch a research grant to investigate a novel treatments for a disease of their choosing. Move information will be provided in the workshops. The timetable for your group's presentation will be announced in the week before the first scheduled presentation. Each group will give their presentation to the whole class during one of the timetabled lecture periods.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: PowerPoint presentations must be emailed to f.simpson@uq.edu.au before 2 pm on the Friday immediately prior to the first scheduled presentation (Friday 26 September 2025).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Short answer questions on the content covered in the second half of the course. It does not cover the content in the first half of the course that was covered in the In Semester Exam. The number of questions and point value of questions from each staff member will reflect the number of lectures given by that staff member. Additional information will be provided on Blackboard and in class.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
